trans-unit.source: Base class for controls that can switch states, such as <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox"></xref>.
A ToggleButton is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, which means that it can contain a single object of any type (such as a string, an image, or a panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked%2A> property specifies the state of the ToggleButton.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsThreeState%2A> property specifies whether the ToggleButton has two or three states.
Customizing the ToggleButton Control To apply the same property settings to multiple ToggleButton controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the ToggleButton, see [ToggleButton Syles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in Button control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> class.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> is checked.

Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Checked"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Occurs when the state of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> is neither on nor off.

To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Indeterminate"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets or sets whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> is checked.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> is checked; false if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> is unchecked; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked*> dependency property.
To be added.
Determines whether the control supports two or three states.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked%2A> property can be set to `null` as a third state when IsThreeState is `true`.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control supports three states; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsThreeState*> dependency property.
To be added.
Called when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> raises a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Checked"></xref> event.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Checked"></xref> event.
Called when a control is clicked by the mouse or the keyboard.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ToggleButtonAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Called when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> raises an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Indeterminate"></xref> event.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Indeterminate"></xref> event.
Called by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.OnClick*> method to implement toggle behavior.
This method toggles the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked%2A> property.
Called when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> raises an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Unchecked"></xref> event.
The event data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.Unchecked"></xref> event.
Returns the string representation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> object.

The ToString method returns a string that contains the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> and the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked%2A> property.
String representation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> object.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> is unchecked.
